nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MaterialColor
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.
          
          
            
            	COMMENT Represents the surface color of a block when rendered from the {@link net.minecraft.client.gui.MapRenderer}.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MaterialColor
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor
+	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.

nodes.bodyText: "Selected by the Material the block uses." is redundant and confusing. That is a property of materials, not the color. And a map color can be specified for a block that is unrelated to the material.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MaterialColor
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor
+	COMMENT The color that a block will have on a {@link net.minecraft.item.FilledMapItem map item}. Selected by the Material the block uses.

nodes.bodyText: Why is Top necessary here? As described in the documentation, map colors represent the surface color of the block. This is just a blockstate sensitive getter for the map color, no?
What is "default" about this? Does it not just return the blocks map color as defined by the settings?
It pulls the default blockstate for the color
What makes this a factory? Is it constructing new colors? If not, it is a provider.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -220,10 +220,10 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_4970 net/minecraft/block/AbstractBlock
 		FIELD field_23186 emissiveLightingPredicate Lnet/minecraft/class_4970$class_4973;
 		METHOD <init> (Lnet/minecraft/class_3614;Ljava/util/function/Function;)V
 			ARG 1 material
-			ARG 2 materialColorFactory
+			ARG 2 mapColorFactory

nodes.bodyText: Might have been matcher, since one of the constructors is a Function<BlockState, MapColor>
